snippet.title: Tarzan's Aussie Survivor tactic
snippet.content:
QUEENSLAND lime farmer Mark "Tarzan" Herlaar, has become a fan favourite on Australian Survivor for one reason - his honesty. Herlaar, 52, who lives just outside Toowoomba said he could never be different to what he is like in everyday life, and that is a good, honest person. "What I wanted to do is show people who I was," he said. "I didn't go in there to try and be someone else. "I just thought, be yourself, just has I was on my audition tape, and that's what I did. "I was really happy with it. "I could happy I could be in an environment where I could be me." Herlaar, who has two children and is a grandfather, said being on Australian Survivor was only a positive experience, despite all the back stabbing and blind sides, which has happened from the beginning of this series. "It has been a dream come true," he said. "I had a blast."
Meet the guys and gals from Australian Survivor 2017.
See Australian Survivor contestants series 2 Herlaar revealed that he got the name Tarzan on the very first day of Australian Survivor filming in Samoa. "There was a bit of banter between the whole tribe, and young Pete looks over at me and says straight up, he looks like Tarzan," he said. "It just stuck. "Jonathan asked if I minded being called that and I didn't, because there was another Mark. "It felt like an honour, going into the jungle and being called Tarzan to be honest."
